Fast-Growing Open-Source Projects Overview | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Here are some standout open‑source projects that have grown rapidly over the past two years—not just in overall popularity, but in real momentum measured by metrics like GitHub stars, forks, watchers, and active contributors:

Fast-Growing Open-Source Projects

1. Low-Code Projects – Star Growth in Q1 2025

A curated list highlights the top 15 open-source low‑code projects on GitHub by fastest star growth between December 31, 2024 and March 31, 2025, based on data from OSSInsight. Though project names weren’t detailed in the source I found, this clearly signals a strong surge in popularity in that sector. (OSS Insight, NocoBase)

2. ROSS Index – Open-Source Startups

The Runa Open Source Startup (ROSS) Index tracks the annualized growth rate (AGR) of GitHub stars for open-source startups. It highlights projects with explosive developer interest on a quarterly or yearly basis. (Runa Capital)

3. Home Assistant – Contributions Explosion

Home Assistant surged dramatically: in GitHub’s “State of the Octoverse” (2024), it was the top open-source project by number of contributors, with over 21,000 contributors—a leap from around 6,300 in 2019. (Wikipedia)

4. AI Landscape – Llama, Yi-34B, and the AI Surge

  • Meta’s Llama models have soared in popularity—Meta’s open-source models surpassed one billion downloads by March 2025, rapidly gaining adoption among major players like Spotify. (IT Pro)
  • Chinese startup 01.AI’s Yi‑34B also gained rapid traction after release, topping the Hugging Face model leaderboard and fueling community development. (WIRED)
  • On a broader scale, GitHub reported that over 100,000 new open-source AI projects were started in the last year, marking an order‑of‑magnitude increase from pre‑ChatGPT levels. (theverge.com)

5. TLDR Pages – Steady Star and Fork Growth

As of July 2025, TLDR Pages had amassed more than 56,260 stars and 4,500 forks, indicating healthy sustained popularity for this helpful documentation tool. (Wikipedia)

Summary Overview

  • Rapid Star Growth: Especially in low-code platforms, with top projects skyrocketing in early 2025.
  • Contributor Explosion: Home Assistant saw unprecedented contributor growth over the last few years.
  • AI Open-Source Boom: Heavy growth in AI models (Llama, Yi-34B) and tens of thousands of new AI repositories on GitHub, signaling developer enthusiasm.
  • Sustained Popularity: Projects like TLDR Pages maintain strong star and fork counts, reflecting continued community support.
  • Focused Indices: Tools like the ROSS Index and OSSInsight dashboards offer real-time metrics for fastest-growing projects.
